title: Product Rule of Exponents
text: For any real number a and natural numbers $$m$$ and $$n$$, the product rule of exponents states that $$a^m a^n=a \left(m+n\right)$$.
speech: For any real number a and natural numbers  m  and  n , the product rule of exponents states that , a to the m-th a to the n-th is equal to a, parentheses m plus n,  .

title: Product Rule of Exponents
text: Use the product rule to simplify the expression: $${\left(\frac{2}{y}\right)}^4 \frac{2}{y}={\left(\frac{2}{y}\right)}^4 {\left(\frac{2}{y}\right)}^1={\left(\frac{2}{y}\right)}^{4+1}$$
speech: Use the product rule to simplify the expression:  parentheses 2 over y,  to the fourth 2 over y is equal to parentheses 2 over y,  to the fourth times, parentheses 2 over y,  to the first is equal to parentheses 2 over y,  raised to the 4 plus 1 power
